name: House Crow
description: The cawing urban scavenger. Originating from southern Asia, it is an invasive species in various countries, including Malaysia.

name: Common Myna
description: A common sight, and often noisy.It occurs naturally in Malaysia, but is a highly invasive species in many regions such as Australia.

name: Ornate Sunbird
description: Small but easy to spot by its distinctive blue-and-yellow colour. Found among flowers. The female sunbird lacks the distinctive blue throat.

name: Black-naped Oriole
description: Highly visible yellow bird. Very widespread with 20 different subspecies. Has a distinctive dipping flight pattern.

name: White-throated Kingfisher
description: A tree kingfisher commonly found away from water.Vivid red bill and bright blue wings makes it highly distinct.
